results.title: A Man with a plan
results.brief_description: This animated film illustrates the organization and functioning of Labor-Management Production Committees (L.M.P.C.). Through the account of an L.M.P.C. organizer we learn how such committees serve to improve labor-management relations, factory efficiency, employee morale and accident safety records. He tells how, upon visiting a factory where there was friction between management and labor, he was able to clear away the individual objections of the manager, the superintendent, the union president and a laborer to an L.M.P.C., and to help start a committee in their factory.

results.title: A Man on trial
results.brief_description: What happens in England when a man is arrested and put on trial on a charge of burglary; illustrated by the case of John Ludd who was caught one night running away from a house that had been broken into. The film follows the course of justice stage by stage, giving details of police and court procedure; and shows how the rights of the accused man are safeguarded, whatever his previous record.

results.title: A Man of the wilderness
results.creator_credit: Georges Robin, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: In the southern part of France there is a part which is stark because of the lack of water, and almost impossible to live off. But one man, Phillippe Lamour bought a farm in the area. During the war he cultivated his vines and made a success of it. Other Langadock farmers came to look upon him as a leader. After the end of the war he lobbied government to provide funds for an irrigation project. After 12 years of frustration the project finally started - irrigation enabled farmers to produce extra goods, their standard of living increased by 40%-50%. Lamour’s vision of agriculture, industry and tourism is now being realised.

results.title: A Look outside (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and Zero 16 Films
results.brief_description: An optional job experience scheme from 4th form at Nenae College helps students bridge the gap between the classroom and the world outside. Various students are shown gaining experience as a surveyor’s assistant, hairdresser, vet’s assistant and farm worker, working one day a week along side adults in these fields.

results.title: A Long shot that paid off: CSIRO's atomic aborption project
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The discovery in the early 19th century that chemical elements could be identified by observing their emission spectra lead to the development of accurate methods of chemical analysis based on atomic emission spectra. But it was nearly 100 years before Dr A. Walsh of the CSIRO Division of Chemical Physics started asking questions and became convinced that there would be many fundamental advantages in using spectrochemical methods based on atomic absorption spectra. Despite many technical difficulties and lack of interest overseas, Dr Walsh and his colleagues persisted and finally showed that the technique they had devised, had widespread applications in fields as diverse as medicine, engineering, agriculture and mineral exploration. Cinematography: Peter Bruce

results.title: A Long hour's walk
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Father Rene Garcia walks through the outskirts of Bogota and discusses the poverty of both urban and rural Colombian working class. In the face of poverty, hunger, illness and premature death, can there still be hope?

results.title: A Loaf of bread
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the whole process for the production of bread, beginning with the planting and harvesting of wheat and the milling of flour. After scenes showing the preparation of the dough, animated drawings show how the bread is carried through the oven on an endless belt, coming out baked and ready for delivery.

results.title: A Little phantasy on a 19th century painting (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Isle of the Dead, by the 19th Century painter Arnold Boecklin, is the subject of this McLaren experimental film. The spectral island wakes to mysterious life, flickers in candlelight and fades again into the dark - the whole effect heightened by an interpretive musical score. Music, Louis Applebaum. (Award: Salerno.)

results.title: A Little life
results.creator_credit: Deborah Howlett and Vicious Circle Productions
results.brief_description: This program explores the life and death of a 19 year old Aboriginal youth who was shot while trying to escape from Canning Vale Remand centre in Perth. His death is one of 35 in Western Australia investigated by the Muirhead Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody. These facts alone cannot tell the story of Ricci Vicenti whose creativity, humour and sheer zest for life impressed everyone with whom he came in contact. This narrative documentary poses many questions about Australian society, its laws, its sense of justice, cross cultural attitudes and the experiences of Aboriginal people with the law. Ricci’s story is told by his mother and foster mother and juxtaposed with the news coverage of the time. A moving exploration of a rich but short life.
